SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Extend Cart Save and Validation Logic in Fewer Steps

With the Shopping Cart page version 2.0, you gain access to a more robust cart pricing API and more flexible extension points.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: Previous versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce used hard-coded logic to call the ccrz.cc_api_CartExtension extension point when saving the cart. Now, the ccrz.ccApiCart class includes a new method, saveCart(), that replaces the hard-coded extension call with a new extensible logic class, ccrz.ccLogicCartSave. This logic class validates and saves the cart, and you can easily extend this class to modify cart save and validation behavior. The class includes the following extensible, placeholder methods that are empty by default:

externalPriceValidation()
updateBeforeSave()

This change doesn’t affect the CC Cart object data model, so your existing cart data is compatible with the new API.

How: After you upgrade the available global data, the Cart module’s Use Cart Page 2.0 configuration setting is available and TRUE by default.

If you previously extended the Shopping Cart page version 1.0, migrate your extensions to the Shopping Cart page version 2.0 where necessary.

NOTE B2B Commerce for Visualforce continues support for the Shopping Cart page version 1.0. To revert, change the Use Cart Page 2.0 configuration setting to FALSE.
SEE ALSO
Shopping Cart Page Extensions for Version 2.0
(Salesforce Developers) ccrz.ccLogicCartSave
(Salesforce Developers) ccrz.cc_api_CartExtension

title: Extending Cart Save and Validation Logic
